Name: PayPal
Name_1: How Peter Thiel became the most feared man in Silicon Valley
Text_1:
PayPal founder Peter Thiel liked Mark Zuckerberg for the same reasons most people couldn‚Äôt stand him.

Though the Facebook CEO is often criticized for being robotic and unfeeling Thiel saw the younger man‚Äôs indifference as ‚Äúa sign of intelligence‚Äù writes Max Chafkin in his book ‚ÄúThe Contrarian‚Äù (Penguin Press) out now.

The two formed a mutual respect based on their iconoclastic ways.

‚ÄúZuckerberg like Thiel had stuck it in the eye of his politically correct peers when he‚Äôd hacked Harvard‚Äôs online directory to create FaceMash.‚Äù At college in the ‚Äô80s Thiel had launched a conservative monthly called The Stanford Review which fearlessly mocked liberals on campus.

When Facebook‚Äôs first president Sean Parker first brought Thiel into the fold as an investor in 2004 he warned Zuckerberg against the financier‚Äôs ‚Äúdirty tricks.‚Äù

But Zuckerberg said he found Thiel‚Äôs tactics inspiring and would even use them to drive his friend and co-founder Eduardo Saverin out of Facebook the next year.

‚ÄúI learned it from him‚Äù Zuckerberg replied to Parker in an instant-message exchange.

‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôll do it to Eduardo.‚Äù

Thiel who turns 54 next month is one of the most cutthroat financiers of his generation. With a fortune of $4.3 billion according to Forbes he‚Äôs difficult to pigeonhole ‚Äî having gone from hedge-fund trader to Silicon Valley entrepreneur to data-mining surveillance capitalist ‚Äî and almost impossible to understand.

‚ÄúHe is self-created a Silicon Valley Oz who has through networking and a capacity for storytelling constructed an image so compelling that it has come to obscure the man behind it‚Äù Chafkin writes.

6 THE ADMIRER: Mark Zuckerberg says he learned from Thiel ‚Äî to cut out friend Eduardo Saverin. Ron Sachs ‚Äì CNP

Many of the people the author contacted for his book ‚Äî millionaires with political power ‚Äî ‚Äútold me they were scared of him‚Äù Chafkin writes. ‚ÄúHe was that powerful and he was that vindictive.‚Äù

Thiel is famously so vengeful that his name itself has become a verb. To ‚ÄúPeter Thiel‚Äù someone is to exact horrible retribution like he did when he brought down gossip Web site Gawker Media in 2016. And as with almost every other takedown in his life he did it without personally pulling the trigger.

The son of German immigrants Thiel was born in Frankfurt and moved with his family to Cleveland Ohio when he was a baby. The Thiels moved frequently before settling in the San Francisco suburb Foster City. He was an outsider from the beginning a fan of science fiction ‚Äî he claimed he had memorized the entire ‚ÄúLord of the Rings‚Äù trilogy ‚Äî and an easy target for bullies ‚Äúeven among people who considered themselves Thiel‚Äôs friends‚Äù writes Chafkin.

One of his bullies who helped plant ‚Äúfor sale‚Äù signs on the front lawn of Thiel‚Äôs home told Chafkin that he ‚Äúalways thought [Thiel] might have a list of people he‚Äôs going to kill somewhere and that I‚Äôm on it.‚Äù

When Thiel enrolled at Stanford in 1985 he was disgusted by the hard-partying antics of his peers. ‚ÄúThey drank; they smoked pot; they hooked up‚Äù writes Chafkin. ‚ÄúNeedless to say Thiel did not partake in any of it. He didn‚Äôt really seem interested in making friends.‚Äù

6 THE CHALLENGER: Elon Musk tried to force Thiel out at PayPal ‚Äî but found himself ousted instead. AP

Instead he started the satirical publication The Stanford Review which lampooned progressive causes with false reports on everything from a new course on black hairdos implying that ‚ÄúStanford had replaced the traditional Western Culture curriculum with discourses on kinky hair‚Äù to a story on how ‚Äúit was impossible to visit a men‚Äôs restroom (on campus) without witnessing a gay sex act.‚Äù

It was also where he first learned to become a ‚Äúpuppet master‚Äù Chafkin writes.

When law student Keith Rabois a frequent contributor to the Review (and like Thiel at the time still very much in the closet) decided in 1992 to hurl homophobic slurs at a professor‚Äôs cottage as an exercise in free speech Thiel didn‚Äôt discourage it.

‚ÄúFa‚Äìot!‚Äù Rabois shouted. ‚ÄúYou are going to die of AIDS. You‚Äôre going to get what‚Äôs coming to you!‚Äù

Overall Thiel felt that outrageous stunt was justified because conservatives [had become] ‚Äútoo conservative‚Äù writes Chafkin. Just like mainstream liberals accepted communists he felt conservatives shouldn‚Äôt be shy about associating with more extreme far-right views.

After graduating from Stanford Law School in ‚Äô92 he worked at a law firm and as a derivatives trader in New York before launching PayPal in California in 1998. The idea was to create a space for financial transactions that couldn‚Äôt be regulated by the government. In other words an anonymous foreign bank account ‚Äúwhich Thiel wanted to make available to all‚Äù Chafkin writes.

‚ÄúIt was a real-world version of the wild arguments he‚Äôd published in his Stanford Review days‚Äù Chafkin writes. ‚ÄúForget bringing down morally bankrupt university administrators ‚Äî PayPal had the potential to bring down governments.‚Äù

6 THE ALLIES: Max Levchin (left) and Keith Rabois (right) are founding members of PayPal. Bloomberg; Getty Images

He brought many of his more outlandish Review scribes like Rabois with him. ‚ÄúI used to think it was a mistake because what does a guy who worked on a weekly newspaper know about tech support?‚Äù said Martin Hellman a Stanford professor who helped design PayPal‚Äôs encryption software. ‚ÄúBut Peter was brilliant in hiring people who recognized him as the leader and would not fight with him.‚Äù

By January of 2000 PayPal was a hot commodity with 9000 new users joining every day. Finding new customers was ‚Äúeasier than catching a cold‚Äù Thiel bragged to The Wall Street Journal. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs spreading as fast as a virus.‚Äù

In February of 2000 Elon Musk called Thiel proposing a fifty-fifty merger. He was worried that PayPal would end up being acquired by a company like Yahoo and X.com Musk‚Äôs online bank would be pushed out of the market.

‚ÄúTogether Musk argued they would have a better shot of surviving‚Äù Chafkin writes. ‚ÄúAnd they would have an easier time dealing with federal regulators if and when the government got around to cracking down on the new digital payment technologies.‚Äù

Thiel agreed but tensions between the two visionaries ran high from the start. Musk insisted on switching servers putting PayPal on a Microsoft platform. He also wanted to change the name to ‚ÄúPayPal by X.com‚Äù eventually phasing out the PayPal name altogether.

6 THE MORTAL ENEMY: Thiel destroyed Nick Denton‚Äôs Gawker after the Web site outed him as gay. AP

But Thiel found a way to oust Musk without getting his hands dirty.

Even though Musk got to be CEO after the merger most of Thiel‚Äôs deputies ‚Äî Stanford alum and Review writers like Paul Marti Max Levchin and David Sacks ‚Äî filled the executive ranks. ‚ÄúX‚Äôs former executives were marginalized and Musk was surrounded by a team that was more loyal to Thiel than to him‚Äù writes Chafkin. He had in effect ‚Äúlaid a sort of trap for Musk.‚Äù

In May 2000 Thiel resigned from the company claiming in an e-mail to employees that he was ‚Äúexhausted‚Äù and that he considered himself ‚Äúmore of a visionary and less of a manager.‚Äù When Musk disappeared for his honeymoon in Australia that fall several Thiel loyalists ‚Äî like PayPal co-founder Max Levchin and Vice President of Finance Roelof Botha ‚Äî issued an ultimatum to Mike Moritz one of the company‚Äôs biggest investors. Either the board fired Musk and installed Thiel as the new CEO or they would walk.

PayPal ‚Äúwouldn‚Äôt have a chance of survival if Levchin the company‚Äôs most talented engineer walked out with half the business development team‚Äù writes Chafkin.

Without any direct involvement from Thiel their demands were met before Musk had returned from his honeymoon. Not only did Thiel seize total control without lifting a finger he also convinced almost all of Musk‚Äôs most ardent defenders to stay with the company.

One former X staffer who declined to give his name met with Thiel to scold him for what happened but after listening to the new CEO discuss his vision for PayPal he left ‚Äúwith a lot of respect for him. It was a formative experience.‚Äù

6 When former wrestler Hulk Hogan filed a lawsuit against Gawker for publishing portions of his private sex tape Thiel secretly contributed $10 million to his legal costs. Reuters

Two years later Thiel sold PayPal to eBay in 2002 for $1.5 billion.

After that Thiel used his PayPal profits to invest in everything from hedge funds to new technologies like Palantir a big data analysis company and a new social networking site called The Facebook. In 2004 Thiel became the company‚Äôs first angel investor laying down $500000 for a 10 percent stake and giving Zuckerberg one piece of advice: ‚ÄúJust don‚Äôt f‚Äìk it up.‚Äù Thiel eventually walked away with a billion dollars for his investment.

But he could also make moves that were surprisingly obtuse. In 2006 Thiel turned down the opportunity to invest in Tesla because as Musk told the author ‚Äúhe doesn‚Äôt fully buy into the climate change thing.‚Äù

As a result ‚ÄúThiel lost out on a chance to own a substantial chunk of a company that would be worth $800 billion by the end of 2020‚Äù Chafkin writes.

Later Thiel showed how ruthless he could be when Gawker published a story in 2007 with the headline ‚ÄúPeter Thiel is totally gay people.‚Äù It wasn‚Äôt exactly an outing ‚Äî Thiel‚Äôs homosexuality was an open secret by that point ‚Äî but still Thiel was furious.

He first hired a private investigative firm to dig into the personal life and finances of Gawker‚Äôs founder Nick Denton. But then he decided to enact revenge in an even more lethal way. In 2016 when former wrestler Hulk Hogan filed a lawsuit against Gawker for publishing portions of his private sex tape Thiel secretly contributed $10 million to his legal costs. Hogan went on to win his lawsuit and was awarded $140 million in damages forcing Gawker to fold.

Later when Thiel‚Äôs involvement was revealed he said it was ‚Äúthe most philanthropic thing I‚Äôve ever done.‚Äù

That same year Thiel became one of the few major figures in Silicon Valley to back Donald Trump in the presidential election. Though they were in many ways polar opposites ‚Äî he was no fan of Trump the ‚Äúlibidinous New Yorker incapable of preserving an inner monologue‚Äù Chafkin writes ‚Äî Trump was also a candidate willing to say the unsayable ‚Äúand for this Thiel would love him.‚Äù

His donations to the Trump campaign led reporters to unearth his 1995 book ‚ÄúThe Diversity Myth‚Äù in which he called date rape ‚Äúbelated regret.‚Äù

In a rare show of remorse Thiel said in a statement: ‚ÄúI wish I‚Äôd never written those things.‚Äù

But a year later at a Stanford Review event he allegedly told a student editor that the apology had been for show. ‚ÄúSometimes you have to tell them what they want to hear‚Äù he allegedly said.

Today he lives in Vienna Austria with his long-time partner Matt Danzeisen whom he married in 2017 and now co-parents a baby daughter. Though he‚Äôs avoided the limelight in recent years he is still feared by many. As anti-monopoly activist Matt Stoller told Chafkin: He‚Äôs ‚Äúa nihilist a really smart nihilist. He‚Äôs entirely about power ‚Äî it‚Äôs the law of the jungle: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm a predator and the predators win.‚Äô ‚Äù
Name_2: Fact check: Treasury proposal wouldn't levy new tax on PayPal Venmo transactions
Text_2:
The claim: Borrowed funds exceeding $600 deposited via smartphone apps would be taxed under a new bill

A proposal from the Department of the Treasury aimed at decreasing tax avoidance has become the subject of misinformation online.

One Facebook post claims the ‚Äúnew tax bill‚Äù would tax transactions exceeding $600 on smartphone apps like PayPal and Venmo.

‚ÄúThat means if you borrow money using any of those things over $600 that money will be taxed again‚Äù reads the Sept. 20 post which was shared more than 1300 times in four days. ‚ÄúYou know who deposits $600 or more into their bank account from outside sources to help them survive? The poor and middle class.‚Äù

The Treasury proposal would change reporting requirements to account for transactions made on smartphone apps. But the claim that it would levy new taxes is wrong.

More:Don't fall for this scam as IRS child tax credit payouts hit bank accounts

‚ÄúIt looks like (the proposal) is just extending to more entities the obligation to report transactions exceeding $600‚Äù Karen Brown a tax law professor at George Washington University told USA TODAY in an email. ‚ÄúIt places these bank surrogates in the same position as others. It is clearly an anti-tax avoidance measure."

Proposal doesn‚Äôt suggest new tax

The Facebook post misconstrues a Treasury proposal that suggests broadening financial reporting to "improve tax compliance."

In May the Treasury proposed requiring financial institutions to report to the Internal Revenue Service annual inflows and outflows from most bank loan and investment accounts. The requirement applies to accounts whose inflows and outflows including paychecks and transactions made via smartphone apps add up to $600. The details of individual transactions would not be reported.

The proposal is an effort to reduce the country‚Äôs annual tax gap ‚Äì the difference between taxes owed and taxes paid ‚Äì which the IRS estimates to be roughly $166 billion per year. It does not suggest levying a new tax.

"First off the proposal does not change what is taxable in any way. It does not authorize Treasury to expand what is taxable at all" David Super a tax law professor at Georgetown University told USA TODAY in an email. "Second the proposal does not specify what particular reporting standards would be adopted."

The claim that borrowed money would be taxed is nonsense too. Personal loans are not considered income and cannot be taxed unless they are forgiven according to Investopedia.

"The statement that borrowing money will be subject to taxation is false: loan proceeds have never been income and hence have never been taxable" Super said.

‚ÄúIt is absolutely false that poor people or anyone is taxed on borrowing funds‚Äù Brown said. ‚ÄúThat's the quintessential feature in our tax system. Borrowed funds are not subject to tax because of the borrower's offsetting obligation to repay.‚Äù

Joey Gates the Facebook user who shared the claim told USA TODAY in a Facebook message that "regardless of whether I have a misunderstanding of the tax proposal or not it is baffling to me that more money would be collected from tax payers while we leave billions of dollars of tax payers money (in) Afghanistan."

Our rating: False

Based on our research we rate FALSE the claim that borrowed funds exceeding $600 deposited via smartphone apps would be taxed under a new proposal. A Treasury proposal would require financial institutions to report annual inflows and outflows including transactions on smartphone apps for most bank loan and investment accounts. But it would not create an additional tax on those funds. Personal loans are not considered income so they cannot be taxed unless they're forgiven.

Our fact-check sources:

Thank you for supporting our journalism. You can subscribe to our print edition ad-free app or electronic newspaper replica here.

Our fact-check work is supported in part by a grant from Facebook.
Name_3: This Week in Apps: PayPal launches ‚Äòsuper app‚Äô Twitter adds crypto tips Apple won‚Äôt take Fortnite back
Text_3:
Welcome back to This Week in Apps the weekly TechCrunch series that recaps the latest in mobile OS news mobile applications and the overall app economy.

The app industry continues to grow with a record 218 billion downloads and $143 billion in global consumer spend in 2020. Consumers last year also spent 3.5 trillion minutes using apps on Android devices alone. And in the U.S. app usage surged ahead of the time spent watching live TV. Currently the average American watches 3.7 hours of live TV per day but now spends four hours per day on their mobile devices.

Apps aren‚Äôt just a way to pass idle hours ‚Äî they‚Äôre also a big business. In 2019 mobile-first companies had a combined $544 billion valuation 6.5x higher than those without a mobile focus. In 2020 investors poured $73 billion in capital into mobile companies ‚Äî a figure that‚Äôs up 27% year-over-year.

This Week in Apps offers a way to keep up with this fast-moving industry in one place with the latest from the world of apps including news updates startup fundings mergers and acquisitions and suggestions about new apps and games to try too.

Do you want This Week in Apps in your inbox every Saturday? Sign up here: techcrunch.com/newsletters

Top Stories

Epic Games dares Apple to let Fortnite for iOS back in the App Store

Following the judge‚Äôs ruling in the Epic-Apple antitrust lawsuit Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney asked Apple to reinstate Epic‚Äôs developer account. But as Epic said it aims to appeal the court‚Äôs ruling Apple informed the company that it won‚Äôt be reinstating Epic‚Äôs account until the appeals have been resolved. In effect that means Fortnite may not return to iOS for years if Epic is forced to wait for the appeal‚Äôs decision to be made final.

Sweeney made the request public by tweeting out a letter he sent to Apple making the request and the company‚Äôs response. The letter promises Apple that Fortnite would play by the rules ‚Äî something that it didn‚Äôt do before when it breached its contract with Apple by implementing its own payments to force the lawsuit. The letter also noted it had already disabled Epic payments server-side since it can‚Äôt update the app on users‚Äô devices. And it said it paid Apple the $6 million in fees ordered by the court which had been gained as a result of routing around Apple‚Äôs in-app purchases with its own system.

But what makes the letter interesting is that it‚Äôs not just Epic asking for re-entry. It‚Äôs daring Apple to follow the current court order.

The judge‚Äôs decision deemed Apple ‚Äúnot a monopoly‚Äù which Apple then jubilantly celebrated saying it‚Äôs something ‚Äúwe‚Äôve known all along‚Äù quoting the judge‚Äôs statement that Apple‚Äôs success was ‚Äúnot illegal.‚Äù However the one part of the case where Epic won was where the judge declared Apple‚Äôs current in-app purchase (IAP) system anticompetitive. The court‚Äôs decision was that Apple would now have to accommodate developers by giving them the choice to include buttons or links to other places where users could pay for their in-app purchases outside the App Store in addition to Apple‚Äôs IAP option.

Sweeney‚Äôs letter tells Apple Fortnite will play by the rules if Apple will. That is if Apple follows the court‚Äôs guidelines to allow buttons and external links to other purchasing mechanisms then Epic would resubmit the Fortnite app. In other words Epic is ready to take advantage of the now legal option to route around Apple‚Äôs IAP system.

Apple though wasn‚Äôt having it. Apple‚Äôs legal team called Epic‚Äôs behavior in the past ‚Äúduplicitous‚Äù when it breached its contract and Apple saw no reason to reinstate the account until the court‚Äôs decision is made final. And of course Sweeney tweeted that too noting that appeals may take up to five years. (So bad news Fortnite players.)

Apple‚Äôs decline may help to signal to other developers not to try to break its rules but for Epic it sets the stage for the next battle ‚Äî one where it‚Äôs not just daring Apple to let it back in based on the new terms but one where it‚Äôs also daring Congress to act too. After all Epic‚Äôs position seems to be if Apple can boot out a multibillion-dollar company that made amends for breaking rules it believed to be illegal then what hope would smaller developers have to ever fight back against the tech giant? And once kicked out there is no other path to iOS. This seems to try to position Apple as the monopolist that the court said it wasn‚Äôt ‚Äî which is what the appeal is all about.

Apps to have a record Q3 with $34B in consumer spending

A new forecast from (the recently busted) App Annie indicates the third quarter will be another good one for the app economy. Consumers worldwide will spend $34 billion on apps and games in Q3 a 20% year-over-year increase in spending. The jump indicates that the COVID-19 pandemic‚Äôs impact on consumer habits and behavior is having a lasting effect when it comes to how people are now using apps for entertainment shopping work and education. Consumer spending on iOS apps grew 15% year over year to $22 billion and 15% year-over-year on Google Play to reach around $12 billion. Most of this revenue is generated by gaming apps which account for 66% of the spend across both app stores. In terms of non-gaming apps iOS commands 76% of consumer spending

Downloads in Q3 will also grow by 10% year-over-year to reach a record high of 36 billion driven by Google Play and particularly downloads in emerging markets like India and Brazil and others.

Weekly News

Apple Updates & News

Apple released the public versions of iOS 15 iPadOS 15 and watchOS 8. iOS 15 adds a number of new features most notably Focus modes which allow you to personalize your experience based on your current context (work sleep driving etc.); a revamped (and sort of controversial) Safari update; improvements to Apple‚Äôs core apps; and more.

iOS 15 adds a number of new features most notably Focus modes which allow you to personalize your experience based on your current context (work sleep driving etc.); a revamped (and sort of controversial) Safari update; improvements to Apple‚Äôs core apps; and more. Apple also released to developers iOS 15.1 beta 1. The new beta adds SharePlay the co-viewing feature for FaceTime which did not make it in time for the public release of iOS 15. It also allows users to store their vaccination records in the Health app by taking a photo. (Or if your health provider syncs your medical records it may be in there already.)

The new beta adds SharePlay the co-viewing feature for FaceTime which did not make it in time for the public release of iOS 15. It also allows users to store their vaccination records in the Health app by taking a photo. (Or if your health provider syncs your medical records it may be in there already.) But! New data from Mixpanel indicates users are taking longer to upgrade to iOS 15 compared with iOS 14 at launch . In its first two days iOS 14 had been adopted by 14.5% of users compared with 8.5% for iOS 15.

. In its first two days iOS 14 had been adopted by 14.5% of users compared with 8.5% for iOS 15. Apple rolled out StoreKit 2 and new in-app purchase capabilities . StoreKit 2 adds new Swift-based APIs that allow developers to determine product entitlements and eligibility for offers get a user‚Äôs history of in-app purchases find out the latest status of a subscription provide a way to request refunds and manage subscriptions from within an app and more. An App Store Server API is also in production for getting users‚Äô IAP history and subscription status. App Store server notifications which provide real-time updates on IAPs to enable developers to create customized experiences are coming soon.

An App Store Server API is also in production for getting users‚Äô IAP history and subscription status. App Store server notifications which provide real-time updates on IAPs to enable developers to create customized experiences are coming soon. iOS 15 brings a major ASO update to the App Store. Now the store will hide the screenshots for the apps you already have installed on your phone which allows other apps and games to gain more visibility. This will be particularly important for those that appear in searches for major brands.

Android Updates & News

Google‚Äôs Android Automotive OS will come to Honda vehicles in 2022 . The integrated version of Android Auto is already available in select Ford GM and Volvo vehicles.

. The integrated version of Android Auto is already available in select Ford GM and Volvo vehicles. Google booted a game and suspended a developer‚Äôs account for using sexually explicit ads to direct users to their app. The ads were causing outrage across social media including Twitter and TikTok due to the nature of the ads which encouraged players to commit sexual assault.

E-commerce/Food Delivery

Amazon is shutting down its Amazon Go app. The app allowed shoppers to go checkout-free at Amazon‚Äôs high-tech convenience stores where cameras and shelf sensors track what you buy. The functionality provided by Amazon Go is now being integrated into Amazon‚Äôs main app the company said.

The app allowed shoppers to go checkout-free at Amazon‚Äôs high-tech convenience stores where cameras and shelf sensors track what you buy. The functionality provided by Amazon Go is now being integrated into Amazon‚Äôs main app the company said. Uber Eats added a new map feature that allows users to search for food nearby by typing in either words or an emoji. That is you could type in an emoji of a hamburger üçî and the map would display the exact distance from your location. The company said the change was introduced because a majority of users would switch to other map apps to find nearby food. Users will also be able to see delivery and pickup options within Uber Eats and the Uber app itself.

Fintech

PayPal launched its new ‚Äúsuper app‚Äù which combines a variety of fintech tools under the hood. The app offers direct deposit with the ability to get paid up to two days early improved bill pay a digital wallet peer-to-peer payments messaging shopping tools ported over from its acquisition of Honey crypto capabilities and a ‚Äúhigh-yield‚Äù savings account (well it‚Äôs 0.40% APY) powered by Synchrony Bank. Some of the features are arriving now others in the weeks and months ahead. And the rollout itself is staggered so you might not see the update right away either.

Following the threat of an SEC lawsuit Coinbase canceled its planned launch of a ‚ÄúLend‚Äù product which would have allowed users to lend their crypto holdings back to the exchange for the promise of earning interest rates that are much higher than traditional savings accounts offer. This sort of functionality is already offered by other platforms like Gemini which is why Coinbase was proceeding toward a launch before the SEC‚Äôs intervention.

This sort of functionality is already offered by other platforms like Gemini which is why Coinbase was proceeding toward a launch before the SEC‚Äôs intervention. Robinhood has begun quietly testing a new crypto wallet feature and cryptocurrency transfer features in a beta version of its app.

and cryptocurrency transfer features in a beta version of its app. European fintech app Revolut launched commission-free stock trading in the U.S. to compete with Robinhood and others.

to compete with Robinhood and others. Square‚Äôs payment processing app glitched last weekend which caused its automatic tipping screen to disappear for hours. The bug hurt restaurant workers baristas and small business owners who lost out on what would have otherwise been hundreds of thousands in tips.

The bug hurt restaurant workers baristas and small business owners who lost out on what would have otherwise been hundreds of thousands in tips. China banned crypto. The country‚Äôs central bank said all cryptocurrency-related activities are now prohibited and overseas exchanges providing services in China are now illegal.

Social

Twitter continued to accelerate its product releases with this week‚Äôs introduction of even more features including those in the crypto space. The company added support for Bitcoin tipping in its recently launched ‚ÄúTip Jar‚Äù feature which allows users to receive one-time payments through third-party services. Now users will be able to add a Bitcoin Lightning wallet (via Strike‚Äôs API) or their Bitcoin address to accept crypto tips. Twitter also plans to support NFT authentication so creators could connect their crypto wallets to Twitter to showcase their NFTs. And Twitter said it‚Äôs planning to roll out recording to Spaces launch a creator fund and other safety features among other things.

Twitter also plans to support so creators could connect their crypto wallets to Twitter to showcase their NFTs. And Twitter said it‚Äôs planning to roll out recording to Spaces launch a creator fund and other safety features among other things. Tumblr launched its subscription service Post+ into open beta in the U.S. The product has been controversial as users worried about how it could impact the site‚Äôs culture. Some users were concerned it gave the appearance of something akin to Twitter‚Äôs verified badge offering an elevated status. Tumblr has since responded to user feedback by removing the blue Post+ badge that appeared next to the names of users who enabled the feature.

Image Credits: Tumblr

Facebook‚Äôs stock tumbled after the company announced Apple‚Äôs privacy changes would have a bigger impact in Q3 and noted it had been underreporting iOS web conversions by approximately 15%. The latter had greatly panicked advertisers into thinking Apple‚Äôs ATT changes were even worse than feared. Investors didn‚Äôt respond well to the admission of the forecast however and the stock dropped several points after the announcement was made.

The latter had greatly panicked advertisers into thinking Apple‚Äôs ATT changes were even worse than feared. Investors didn‚Äôt respond well to the admission of the forecast however and the stock dropped several points after the announcement was made. Pinterest partnered with Albertsons to make recipe pins shoppable. The grocery chain is looking to drive recipe hunters from pins to checkout.

Photos

Apple said it would add a new setting to its iPhone 13 that would allow users to turn off automatic camera switching to the macro camera when users get too close to their subject. There was already a setting that would disable the switching for video recording which indicated that Apple knew that some people would prefer manual control over the switching.

Messaging

Telegram added a host of new features including interactive emoji that display full-screen when tapped new chat themes and livestream recording in an effort to continue to better compete with Messenger WhatsApp iMessage and other messaging apps. The latter new addition could be particularly useful for creators as admins will be able to record video and audio directly from a livestream or video chat. The recorded sessions are then stored in the Saved Messages section.

Image Credits: Telegram

WhatsApp for iOS is working on a new iMessage-like group icon feature that will allow you to create a personalized icon for your group chat.

Streaming & Entertainment

Apple‚Äôs Podcasts app in iOS 15 added personalized recommendations to its ‚ÄúListen Now‚Äù tab in an effort to improve podcast discovery. Sections titled ‚ÄúIf you Like [Show Name]‚Äù will suggest other sows that listeners like you are engaging with while other recommendations will be based on topics you like. A new Shared with You section in Listen Now will display recommendations from friends and family.

Image Credits: Apple

TikTok celebrated the return of Broadway shows in New York with a slate of live programming produced by artists Broadway partners and creators including performances from Broadway casts; backstage tours showing off costumes props and practice spaces; costume and makeup tutorials; and tips and tricks from theater professionals; and more.

with a slate of live programming produced by artists Broadway partners and creators including performances from Broadway casts; backstage tours showing off costumes props and practice spaces; costume and makeup tutorials; and tips and tricks from theater professionals; and more. Discord started testing YouTube integration just weeks after YouTube cracked down on popular Discord music bots. The feature called Watch Together lets Discord members watch YouTube videos (including music videos) together either via a playlist or by pasting in YouTube links.

The feature called Watch Together lets Discord members watch YouTube videos (including music videos) together either via a playlist or by pasting in YouTube links. Clubhouse announced Wave a new way to casually talk with friends on the app. The feature will replace starting private rooms with friends. After you ‚Äúwave‚Äù at people who follow you anyone who accepts will be able to join your private room as a speaker.

The feature will replace starting private rooms with friends. After you ‚Äúwave‚Äù at people who follow you anyone who accepts will be able to join your private room as a speaker. Clubhouse also hired Chelsea Macdonald as head of entertainment partnerships. She previously worked in similar roles at Community Red Bull and Instagram.

Gaming

The Pok√©mon Company offered a sneak peek at the upcoming Pok√©mon Trading Card Game Live which will be available on iOS Android PC and Mac devices. In addition to the classic card trading game the new mobile game will also offer customization options and accessories for your trainer.

which will be available on iOS Android PC and Mac devices. In addition to the classic card trading game the new mobile game will also offer customization options and accessories for your trainer. Outfit7‚Äôs newly launched My Talking Angela 2 a pet simulation game in its popular Talking Tom franchise jumped to No. 1 by global downloads for its debut while Genshin Impact reclaimed the No. 2 spot.

while Genshin Impact reclaimed the No. 2 spot. Pok√©mon Unite reached the No. 1 spot in game downloads in over 62 Countries on Day 1 (September 21st 2021) of its release on the iOS App Store.

Health & Fitness

A report claims disgruntled Noom users said they felt misled by the diet app which had claimed to be an ‚Äúanti-diet‚Äù lifestyle app but whose plans were really just calorie restriction ‚Äî like any other diet app. They were also frustrated by its expensive pricing and canned responses sent by burned-out diet coaches.

Apple‚Äôs Research app was updated with the option to transfer study progress data to other devices via iCloud backup.

Productivity

Google updated its suite of apps for iOS 15 adding support for new features like Focus Mode Spotlight integrations and iPad widgets.

Government & Policy

TikTok parent company ByteDance added time limits for kids under 14 for the Chinese version of TikTok called Douyin. Now teens under 14 will be able to access Douyin only between the hours of 6 AM and 10 PM and will be limited to 40 minutes per day of usage. The changes follow a broader crackdown by the government on the tech industry which includes reducing the time kids spend online which it views as harmful.

The changes follow a broader crackdown by the government on the tech industry which includes reducing the time kids spend online which it views as harmful. An Indian antitrust probe determined Google abused its dominant position in the country to illegally hurt competitors by reducing device manufacturers‚Äô ability and incentive to sell devices running their own version of Android. It also found that Google‚Äôs requirement to pre-install its own apps is in violation of India‚Äôs competition law.

Security & Privacy

Apple improved its Face ID security with iOS 15 to make it more difficult to spoof by using a 3D model for someone‚Äôs face.

to make it more difficult to spoof by using a 3D model for someone‚Äôs face. Apple patched a new zero-day bug that was exploited in the wild by attackers to hack into iPhones and Macs running older versions of iOS and macOS. Successful exploitation of the bug leads to arbitrary code execution with kernel privileges on compromised devices. Meanwhile a researcher has published a complaint that Apple has been non-responsive to their reports of other zero-days.

Meanwhile a researcher has published a complaint that Apple has been non-responsive to their reports of other zero-days. A report from The Washington Post dug into the shady ways apps were tracking users in the post-IDFA era. For instance the game Subway Surfers was shown to be sending specific data points to Chartboost which could then potentially use the data to uniquely identify your iPhone a technique known as fingerprinting. This continues even if the user has asked the app not to track them.

Funding and M&A

üí∞ Facetune maker Lightricks raised $130 million in Series D funding which included $100 million in primary and $30 million in secondary funding and values the company at $1.8 billion. The new round was co-led by New York-based VC firm Insight Partners and Hanaco Venture Capital and will be put toward further product growth across its line of editing and creativity apps as well as acquisitions.

üí∞ Digital bookkeeping app FloBiz raised $31 million in Series B funding led by Sequoia Capital India Think Investments and its existing investors Elevation Capital and Beenext. The app has been downloaded more than 5 million times and has a heavier presence in regions like Maharashtra Delhi NCR Uttar Pradesh Gujarat and Tamil Nadu.

üí∞ London-based grocery delivery app Jiffy raised $28 million in Series A funding led by family-owned investment company Heartland. The app has over 20000 customers across six London-area delivery zones and promises fresh groceries in 15 minutes.

üìà Seattle fintech Remitly available on web and mobile priced its IPO at $43 per share above the expected range of $38 to $42 valuing the business at $6.9 billion.

üí∞ Pakistan fintech TAG raised $12 million in funding from investors including New York-based Liberty City Ventures and Canaan Partners valuing the company at $100 million. Pakistan is the third-largest unbanked market with 100 million users without a bank account which is driving demand for digital banking services.

üí∞ Livestream shopping app NTWRK raised $50 million from Goldman Sachs and luxury group Kering. NTWRK had previously raised a $10 million Series A according to Crunchbase data.

Downloads

Lounge (iOS Mac web)

Lounge launched a remote work app into open beta which creates a more social environment for smaller fully remote teams. The app introduces the concept of virtualized ‚Äúdesks‚Äù showing the time of day for that individual. It also offers ‚Äúrooms‚Äù that can be organized by the company‚Äôs org chart or projects or the rooms can be virtual representations of physical spaces ‚Äî like a meeting room for gatherings or company cafeteria where employees could hang out virtually. Desks and rooms can be locked and made private or they can be unlocked and open. Lounge also adopts features from consumer social apps like photo-sharing and drop-in audio for virtual ‚Äúdesk visits‚Äù and displays employee‚Äôs participation in company-wide events like steps or meditation challenges. Lounge is entering a public beta which means you‚Äôll have to request access for entry. (Read the details on TechCrunch)

Pok√©mon Unite (iOS and Android)

The strategic battle game that first arrived on Nintendo Switch this summer has now arrived on mobile. Pok√©mon Unite offers the same free-to-start multiplayer online battle arena game with the same maps and monsters as on the Switch. It also introduces Unite Squads for teaming up Trainers who can create either their own squads or search for existing ones. With the mobile launch the game supports cross-platform play allowing users to continue their Switch game on their smartphone and to play along with others regardless of which device is being used. Both Android and iOS are supported. Following its debut Pok√©mon Unite reached the No. 1 spot in game downloads in over 62 Countries on Day 1 (September 21st 2021) of its release on the iOS App Store App Annie found. (Read the details on TechCrunch)

Amplosion

With iOS 15 there are a number of new and improved Safari extensions now available. But one worth checking out is Amplosion created by Christian Selig also the developer of popular Reddit client app Apollo. The extension allows you to easily redirect from Google AMP pages to their normal non-AMP counterparts. If however you prefer the AMP versions of some websites you can add them to an in-app Allowlist. The extension will show you how many pages it‚Äôs blocked via an in-app counter and home screen widgets. There‚Äôs even an Easter egg in the form of a digital dog named Lord Waffles that lives in the app who has his own widget too. The extension is also fully open source for transparency. The app is a $2.99 download on the App Store.

Tweets

We have to agree this is waaaay better than ‚Äúbug fixes:‚Äù

Yes it is:
Name_4: Peter Thiel scourge of Silicon Valley
Text_4:
F OR A MAN who wants to live for ever Peter Thiel has already done enough in his 53 years to leave mere mortals exhausted‚Äîand mostly frustrated. The venture capitalist techno-Utopian and scourge of the liberal left is a myriad of contradictions.

He co-founded PayPal a payments platform that as a young libertarian he hoped would undermine the world‚Äôs monetary system. Instead it gave him the money to bestride Silicon Valley a place he disdains. He was the earliest outside investor in Facebook a tech giant on whose board he remains though he mocks social media. As a hedge-fund manager he bet on an economic meltdown in America ahead of the financial crisis of 2007-09 but called the bottom of the market too soon. He was one of the most prominent financiers to throw his weight behind Donald Trump‚Äôs bid for the presidency in 2016. Yet his efforts to populate the Trump administration with radical-thinking acolytes failed.
Name_5: Area roundup: Jennie DeVoe to perform at Cornerstone
Text_5:
FROM NEWS REPORTS

MUNCIE ‚Äî Jennie DeVoe brings her unique brand of humor story-telling and blues to Cornerstone Center for the Arts 520 W. Main St. on Friday Oct. 8 in a fundraiser for the Muncie Senior Citizens Center.

The Indianapolis-based DeVoe performs through the Midwest presenting original songs. The Oct. 8 performance begins at 7 p.m. with doors opening at 6 p.m.

Tickets are $20 and can be purchased through PayPal. Also accepted are Visa Mastercard Discover and American Express Tickets also are available at muncieseniorcenter@gmail.com or by calling the Senior Center at 765-289-0844.

Cornerstone has a mask-on policy for those in the building.

Women's suffrage exhibit on display at Moore-Youse

MUNCIE ‚Äî The exhibit ‚ÄúSecuring the Vote: Women‚Äôs Suffrage in Indiana" sponsored by the Delaware County Historical Society is on display at the Moore-Youse House 715 E. Washington St. until Wednesday Sept. 29.

The exhibit is open 1-5:30 p.m. Friday Saturday and on the last day Wednesday Sept. 29. The exhibit is closed on Sunday Monday and Tuesday.

The exhibit includes information about Muncie suffragettes as well as information about state suffrage and informational posters from the Smithsonian Institution.

The exhibit is free but donations that will support the Delaware County Historical Society operations may be made.

Anyone interested in becoming a member of the Delaware County Historical Society can send a check payable to the organization and mail it along with name and personal contact information to Delaware County Historical Society 120 E. Washington St. Muncie IN 47305. Individual memberships are $20 and family memberships are $30.

'Open Space: Art About the Land' to open Oct. 1

MUNCIE ‚Äî "Open Space: Art About the Land" an annual art exhibition opens on Friday Oct. 1 at Minnetrista. This exhibit encourages Indiana artists to derive creative inspiration from the land and recognizes new artistic creations that celebrate the notion of ‚Äúopen space‚Äù as it relates to the land according to a release.

The juror of this year‚Äôs show is Betsy Stirratt the Founding Director of the Grunwald Gallery of Art at Indiana University Bloomington where she has curated exhibitions and published catalogs since 1987.

Open Space: Art About the Land will be available at Minnetrista Oct. 1-Nov. 7 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Wednesday through Saturday and noon-5 p.m. Sunday.

Open Space is presented by Minnetrista and Red-tail Land Conservancy

For more information about Red-tail Land Conservancy visit fortheland.org. For more information on this and other events visit minnetrista.net or call 765-282-4848.

Local artists to appear at Cornerstone open mic night

MUNCIE ‚Äî Cornerstone Center for the Arts 520 E. Main St. is hosting an evening of music hip hop and the spoken word 6-9 p.m. Friday Oct. 1. There is a $5 cover charge for those attending.

Among those performing according to event promoter Jonathon Bennett are:

The S3 Band: A local live jazz/hip hop duo consisting of multi-instrumentalist and producer Entendre and Soultone Cymbals-sponsored drummer Lamotta Roundtree.

Dillin Helsley: A solo performing artist from Muncie who utilizes a loop pedal to free him up to play a trumpet for example. His primary genres are reggae folk and hip-hop.

Kiana: Indianapolis' own conscious hip hop star who appears on the compilation Scripts Vol. 1 which was released earlier this year on vinyl and runs her own independent imprint called Mind Heavy Music.

Mel Cap: Muncie's own concrete wordsmith a former competitor in Fort Wayne's Bloodsport Battle League who has shared the stage with such nationally-recognized talent as the controversial 2 Live Crew and more.

There are few slots left open for performers in the last hour of the event. They might be filled before the event but if there is interest contact Bennett at jbennett@cornerstonearts.org.

Send news items to The Star Press at news@muncie.gannett.com.

Name: PepsiCo
Name_1: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi has a piece of advice for her younger self teases book with MMS-Obama meet
Text_1:
If you had the opportunity to call up your past self and give them a piece of wisdom what would it be? To this ver‚Ä¶ https://t.co/svlwneHWA4 ‚Äî Indra Nooyi (@IndraNooyi) 1632498838000

You Might Also Like: How can you up your chances of staying in a job by 70%? Rishad Premji has the answer

Former chairman and CEO of PepsiCo Indra Nooyi will be releasing her memoir ' My Life in Full : Work Family and Our Future' on September 28. As the former CEO waits for her book to hit the shelves she took to her official Twitter account to interact with her over 89K followers."If you had the opportunity to call up your past self and give them a piece of wisdom what would it be?" the 65-year-old asked. Sharing a picture from her teen years Nooyi further reflected on her own past.The New York City based business executive shared the advice she'd give her younger self. "To this version of myself I would say ‚Äî when you take on something give it everything you‚Äôve got. If people can‚Äôt accept you for who you are it‚Äôs their loss" Nooyi added.Nooyi who was termed as one of the world's most admired CEOs for many years shared her journey through the events that shaped her in her book. From her childhood and early years in India to her Yale School of Management experience and her rise to the corporate world the book tells it all. Thrilled about her book launch Nooyi even shared the first few pages from 'My Life in Full: Work Family and Our Future' book.The story begins with Nooyi finding herself in a room alongside then President of America and Prime Minister of India. "One foggy Tuesday in November 2009 after hours of meetings in Washington DC with two dozens top US and Indian business executives I found myself standing between the president of the United States and the prime minister of India. Barack Obama and Manmohan Singh had entered the room for an update on our group's progress and President Obama began introducing the American team to his Indian counterpart. When he got to me - Indra Nooyi CEO of PepsiCo - Prime Minister Singh exclaimed "Oh! But she is one of us!"And the president with a big smile and without missing a beat responded "Ah but she is one of us too!" the first page of Nooyi's book read which she shared on LinkedIn.Just like the former CEO people are extremely excited to get their hands on the book as well while those who preordered it and are currently reading it are in absolute awe of the business executive."I keep smiling/ chuckling to myself at the warmth and authenticity that is on every page. Thank you Indra Nooyi for this gift" a person replied to Nooyi's post.While many expressed a keen desire to read Nooyi's life journey after all she was consistently ranked among the world's 100 most powerful women. In 2015 Nooyi bagged the second spot on the Fortune list of most powerful women.In 2019 she again got the second rank as the most powerful woman but this time on the Forbes list of The 19 Most Powerful Women in Business.Nooyi who was born in Madras (now called Chennai) in the year of 1955 is currently on the boards of Amazon and the International Cricket Council.
Name_2: Indra Nooyi on a trailblazing life
Text_2:
Indra Nooyi's office in Greenwich Conn. looks like a shrine to rock 'n' roll. In fact Nooyi the former CEO of PepsiCo one of the most iconic brands in the world was something of a rock star herself in her native India.

"I was in an all-girls rock band when I was in high school" she told correspondent Mola Lenghi. "Remember I was in a Catholic school so songs that were appropriate to those nuns but they were good songs!"

"The nuns picked the band name?" Lenghi asked.

"Nuns picked the name Logarithms because we were studying Logarithm Table."

"Nothing says rock 'n' roll like nuns picking your band name!"

Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi with her guitar collection. CBS News

Nooyi went on to become a rock star in the corporate world. Tapped to lead PepsiCo in 2006 she was one of only a handful of female CEOs at Fortune 500 companies.

"In 2018 when I retired as CEO of the Fortune 500 out of 500 companies there were 41 women CEOs" she said. "Now you can read it as great progress from zero to 41. Or you can say in 25 years we moved from zero percent to about eight-and-a-half percent. Is that progress? Yes and no."

Though technically retired she's still hard at work trying to improve not just one company but all companies. How? Simple really: more women.

"Women are 50 percent of the population" she said. "Women get more college degrees than men. They're 70 percent of high school valedictorians. They are over-represented in professional schools."

But at some point their career paths derail. Today women account for roughly a quarter of senior leadership jobs.

Nooyi takes aim at this disparity in a new memoir chronicling her self-admittedly improbable rise to becoming as Fortune magazine described "one of the most powerful women in the world."

Portfolio

Lenghi asked "Do you consider your time as CEO of PepsiCo a success?"

"I'd say it was a pretty good success" Nooyi replied. "Did bold things did transformational things did things that people at that time criticized before but now call it prescient."

She pushed the more-than-100-year-old company to put families first by focusing on challenges facing women in the workplace offering generous paid family leave and help with childcare.

Nooyi said "The biological clock and the career clock are in conflict. Some people are delaying childbirth for many many years freezing their eggs or just not having children at all. Others are saying 'I can't keep working I can't go through this rat race.' So my point is we've got to make it less of a rat race."

Her ideas on family are rooted in her own experience ‚Äì one that began in a strict but loving multi-generational home in Chennai India: "[Being] in a family that believed the girls should be allowed to soar as much as the boys made a huge difference huge difference."

In 1978 Nooyi was accepted into Yale Business School so off to America she went some 8000 miles from everything she had ever known. One of the few women (and even fewer minorities) in her class she arrived on campus to a rude awakening.

"Nobody's smiling to welcome you. I'm like 'Oh my God what have I done?' And I'm starving. How do I get food? I go to the grocery store. Ultimately I bought a loaf of bread a tomato and some potato chips and I ate it crying saying 'What have I done?'"

Turns out she knew exactly what she was doing. Nooyi graduated got married to her husband Raj and had two daughters Preetha and Tara all while working more than full time eventually landing a job at PepsiCo and climbing the corporate ladder.

In 2000 she was appointed president of the company. She rushed home to tell her family the news but was quickly humbled by her mother: "She said 'You know I don't care if you're president or on the board. I don't even know what that means. But let me just tell you when you walk in this door you're a mother you're a wife you're a daughter you're a daughter-in-law. That's all you are in this house. So please do me a favor just leave that crown in the garage.'"

Indra Nooyi. CBS News

She says it was a critical life lesson: "That's why I always say work and life is not a balance; it's a juggling act. And how you juggle this every day is the big challenge.

"Look tradeoffs are part of everybody's life. Being a mom being an executive ‚Äì how do I be the best at everything? ‚Äì are painful emotional tradeoffs. So I think back at some of those and there is hurt. I feel pain I feel a loss."

While she has forgiven herself the reminders of time with family that she traded for time in the office are still present. She show Lenghi some of the sacred artifacts are at once a mother's mementoes of her children and a CEO's lesson in the sacrifices made for success.

"When I found them there was so painful and poignant and emotional. I thought I should keep them very very carefully."

"Dear Mom I really love you. I really would appreciate if you came home early. Please please please please please please. If you say yes I love you again."

CBS News

Lenghi asked "You kept these things all these years. Why?"

"I don't know I cannot get myself to not look at them regularly" she replied.

Despite the tough choices Nooyi said she has no regrets and wants the same for other women. And while her mission is gender equity she insists it can also be good business.

"I approach it as an economist first rather than just a feminist because it's such a lost opportunity. Women are smart. They're driven. They want the power of the purse. They want to work. They want economic freedom. Let's harness their capabilities."



For more info:



Story produced by Amol Mhatre. Editor: Remington Korper.
Name_3: The People v. Cap'n Crunch: Inside the Crunch Berry Lawsuits
Text_3:
For nearly 60 years Cap‚Äôn Crunch and Toucan Sam have served the public honorably. One is a respected seaman; the other is a beloved immigrant. In 1963 each launched a new fruity breakfast cereal that quickly became part of the very fabric of this country. But despite their obvious contributions to the American (breakfast) experience both came under assault about a decade ago by people claiming the mascots had been knowingly deceitful.

Beginning in 2007 multiple Californians declared that they were tricked by Froot Loops and Crunch Berries because due to the names of the cereals they believed the cereals contained a significant amount of real fruit. As ridiculous as this sounds these claims were strong enough ‚Äî or at least presented the prospect of a big enough payday ‚Äî to attract several different law firms as there were a total of seven of these nearly identical lawsuits from 2007 to 2010. ‚ÄúAll of them were brought under California‚Äôs Consumer Protection Law‚Äù explains Kevin Underhill a partner at the law firm Shook Hardy & Bacon and the author of The Emergency Sasquatch Ordinance: And Other Real Laws That Human Beings Actually Dreamed Up. He adds that while these kinds of laws make it easier to sue companies for wrongdoing they can result in absurd cases as well.

The Froot Loops and Crunch Berries lawsuits never amounted to much as they were deemed to be entirely frivolous (and one was tossed out on legal technicalities). Regardless they do offer something to the annals of legal history ‚Äî namely they‚Äôre the most absurd and hilarious court documents ever filed. And so with Underhill as my guide I pulled out some of the most insane bits of legal lunacy from each.

McKinnis v. Kellogg July 2007

The court summary for the first of these lawsuits states that the ‚Äúplaintiffs a married couple allege that they wanted to purchase healthy cereal for their children so they purchased this product because they believed that based on the front panel of the cereal box that the cereal contained actual fruit.‚Äù

Apparently they were lead to believe this because of ‚Äúthe use of the word ‚ÄòFroot‚Äô in the name [and] the depiction of brightly colored rings of cereal that plaintiffs claim resemble fruit.‚Äù But the most ridiculous part of their claim is where it says that the ‚Äúplaintiffs purchased [Froot Loops] from time to time over the past four years.‚Äù

Four fucking years! It took them that long to realize that Froot Loops weren‚Äôt real fruit!

Unsurprisingly the case was ruled against the plaintiffs as a misuse of the Consumer Protection Law. The ruling highlights the different spellings of ‚Äúfruit‚Äù and ‚ÄúFroot‚Äù but really eye-rolls the plaintiffs‚Äô claim that the cereal resembles actual fruit. The ruling states ‚ÄúPlaintiffs‚Äô allegation that the cereal pieces themselves resemble fruit is not rational let alone reasonable. The cereal pieces are brightly colored rings which in no way resemble any currently known fruit.‚Äù

Underhill who has covered these cases extensively for Forbes as well as his legal humor blog ‚ÄúLowering the Bar‚Äù explains that some lawyers ‚Äî himself included ‚Äî relish the opportunity to be funny in a ruling. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt occur often and you have to be very careful and appropriate but once in a while you get the perfect opportunity‚Äù he tells me.

Videtto v. Kellogg June 2008

A layman would rightfully assume that a ridiculous lawsuit that‚Äôs been laughed out of court might dissuade similar filings in the future but Underhill explains that this isn‚Äôt always the case. On the contrary actually: ‚ÄúMany lawyers have alerts to let them know of these kinds of cases‚Äù as they‚Äôre looking to jump on the bandwagon if they sniff an opportunity. That‚Äôs how you get a case like Videtto v. Kellogg which made the exact same arguments as McKinnis v. Kellogg and was dismissed in much the same manner.

‚ÄúThe packaging makes clear that the product is a ‚Äòmulti-grain‚Äô cereal and truthfully depicts that cereal in the shape of multi-colored rings rings that do not resemble any known fruit‚Äù the ruling states. ‚ÄúMoreover defendant uses the word ‚ÄòFroot‚Äô as part of its trademarked name and the fanciful use of a nonsensical word cannot reasonably be interpreted to imply that the product contains or is made from actual fruit.‚Äù

Sugawara v. PepsiCo Inc. June 2008 and July 2009

With a couple of swipes at Toucan Sam having failed someone decided to put Cap‚Äôn Crunch to the test over the use of the word ‚Äúberries‚Äù in Crunch Berries cereal. For this one Underhill says his favorite excerpt from the case summary reads ‚ÄúIn addition to the use of the word ‚Äòberries‚Äô in the product name the product‚Äôs principal display panel the portion of the product box designed to face consumers as they shop in a market aisle features the product‚Äôs namesake ‚ÄòCap‚Äôn Crunch‚Äô thrusting a spoonful of ‚ÄòCrunch Berries‚Äô at the prospective buyer.‚Äù

As such for his Forbes write-up on the case Underhill wanted to go with the headline ‚ÄúLawsuits Accuse Sea Captain of Thrusting His Berries at Unsuspecting Consumers.‚Äù Sadly Forbes went with the much more conservative ‚ÄúCalifornia Plagued With ‚ÄòFrooty‚Äô Lawsuits.‚Äù

The plaintiff also borrowed the Fruit Loops argument pretty much verbatim: ‚ÄúThe Crunch Berries are pieces of cereal in bright fruit colors shaped to resemble berries. While close inspection reveals that the Crunch Berries are not really berries plaintiff contends that the colorful Crunch Berries combined with use of the word ‚Äòberry‚Äô in the product name convey the message that Cap‚Äôn Crunch is not all sugar and starch but contains redeeming fruit.‚Äù

Again however the judge wasn‚Äôt buying it writing ‚ÄúWhile the challenged packaging contains the word ‚Äòberries‚Äô it does so only in conjunction with the descriptive term ‚Äòcrunch.‚Äô This court is not aware of nor has plaintiff alleged the existence of any actual fruit referred to as a ‚Äòcrunch berry.‚Äô‚Äù An even better burn comes later: ‚ÄúAs far as this court has been made aware there is no such fruit growing in the wild or occurring naturally in any part of the world.‚Äù

Janine Sugawara the plaintiff in this case also pursued it as a class-action lawsuit which was similarly dismissed. With two cases against Quaker Oats ‚Äî which Pepsi owns ‚Äî Sugawara was briefly the queen of frivolous cereal lawsuits. Within a year though she‚Äôd be overshadowed by a man named Roy Werbel.

Werbel v. Kellogg and Werbel v. PepsiCo Inc. September 2009 and March 2010

On September 22 2009 Werbel filed two lawsuits ‚Äî one against Kellogg and the other against PepsiCo. The Kellogg claim was dismissed because Werbel‚Äôs lawyers failed to actually serve Kellogg with the lawsuit ‚Äî whoops! It didn‚Äôt go much better when Werbel tried again the following April.

As for his claim against Cap‚Äôn Crunch Werbel didn‚Äôt show up to a case management conference but he eventually got his shit together and was able to proceed with things the following July. None of it was all that original. As with the others Werbel maintained that ‚Äúthe colorful Crunch Berries on the [cereal box] combined with the ‚Äòberry‚Äô in the product name conveys only one message: that Cap‚Äôn Crunch has some nutritional value derived from fruit‚Äù and that the package had led him to believe that ‚ÄúCrunch Berries is a combination of Crunch biscuits and colorful red purple teal and green berries.‚Äù

The judge savaged him in response: ‚ÄúIt is obvious from the product packaging that no reasonable consumer would believe that Cap‚Äôn Crunch derives any nutritional value from berries. As an initial matter the term ‚ÄòBerries‚Äô is not used alone but always is preceded by the word ‚ÄòCrunch‚Äô to form the term ‚ÄòCrunch Berries.‚Äô The image of the Crunch Berries which is ‚ÄòENLARGED TO SHOW TEXTURE‚Äô shows four cereal balls with a rough textured surface in hues of deep purple teal chartreuse green and bright red. These cereal balls do not even remotely resemble any naturally occurring fruit of any kind.‚Äù

With that the cereal lawsuits drew to a close and Toucan Sam and the Cap‚Äôn have been more or less left alone since. Which I have to say is kinda disappointing. I understand that these lawsuits are total money-grabs that waste the time of important judges and lawyers ‚Äî to say nothing of taxpayer money ‚Äî but they do provide some levity in a pretty miserable world. Perhaps then I can remind all the serial cereal litigants out there that a certain white rabbit has been selling fruity cereal since 1954.
Name_4: When Indian PM and US President both claimed Indra Nooyi as one of theirs
Text_4:
(You can now subscribe to our

(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channel

Indian-American Indra Nooyi  the former chairperson and CEO of PepsiCo  still vividly remembers a 2009 meeting with the then US president Barack Obama and former prime minister Manmohan Singh during which both claimed: "she is one of us"."I belong in both worlds" Chennai-born Nooyi 65 writes in her new memoir "My Life in Full: Work Family and Our Future" recollecting the memorable events of November 2009 when Obama had hosted Singh for his first state dinner.In the memoir set to hit the bookstores next Tuesday Nooyi describes the events that shaped her life from childhood to her becoming Pepsico CEO a position from which she retired in 2018."One foggy Tuesday in November 2009 after hours of meetings in Washington DC with two dozen top US and Indian business executives I found myself standing between the president of the United States and the prime minister of India" she writes in the introduction of the memoir that runs into over 300 pages."Barack Obama and Manmohan Singh had entered the room for an update on our group's progress and President Obama began introducing the American team to his Indian counterpart. When he got to me-Indra Nooyi CEO of PepsiCo-Prime Minister Singh exclaimed "Oh! But she is one of us!""And the president with a big smile and without missing a beat responded "Ah but she is one of us too!""It's a moment I never forget-spontaneous kindness from the leaders of the two great countries that have given me so much" Nooyi writes in the memoir an advance copy of which was obtained by PTI."I am still the girl who grew up in a close family in Madras in the South of India and I am deeply connected to the lessons and culture of my youth. I am also the woman who arrived in the US at age twenty-three to study and work and somehow rose to lead an iconic company a journey that I believe is possible only in America. I belong in both worlds" she writes narrating her immigrant story.From a sari-clad intern at Booz Allen Hamilton rising to the post of Pepsico CEO Nooyi writes that the business world has improved immeasurably for women in the US since she started her professional career.Nooyi writes that more recently the #MeToo movement and Time's Up campaigns have had a profound impact on exposing the degree to which women are subjected to sexual violence and harassment. The movement and campaigns have created a necessary community for survivors she observes."I was never sexually assaulted. I did witness and hear about plenty of male behaviour early in my days in the corporate world that offended my sense of decency and my values. I later made it a priority to shut down offensive behaviour as soon as I saw it or it became known" Nooyi writes.Nooyi says after she became PepsiCo's president she instructed the compliance department to address harassment complaints made to their anonymous Speak Up Line immediately."We were quick to fire confirmed harassers" she writes.In the book she rues that women hold just 26 per cent of US corporate board seats."In my view companies should consider setting term limits on board members of fifteen years and a mandatory retirement age of seventy-two. Immediately they could also expand their boards by one or two members to make room for qualified people who better understand the issues facing working women and young families" she said.
Name_5: When Indian PM and US President both claimed Indra Nooyi is one of theirs
Text_5:
When Indian PM and US President both claimed Indra Nooyi is one of theirs

A A A

PTI Sep 26 2021 10:31 AM IST

Washington: Indian-American Indra Nooyi the former chairperson and CEO of PepsiCo still vividly remembers a 2009 meeting with the then US president Barack Obama and former prime minister Manmohan Singh during which both claimed: ‚Äùshe is one of us‚Äù.

‚ÄúI belong in both worlds‚Äù Chennai-born Nooyi 65 writes in her new memoir ‚ÄúMy Life in Full: Work Family and Our Future‚Äù recollecting the memorable events of November 2009 when Obama had hosted Singh for his first state dinner.

In the memoir set to hit the bookstores next Tuesday Nooyi describes the events that shaped her life from childhood to her becoming Pepsico CEO a position from which she retired in 2018.

‚ÄúOne foggy Tuesday in November 2009 after hours of meetings in Washington DC with two dozen top US and Indian business executives I found myself standing between the president of the United States and the prime minister of India‚Äù she writes in the introduction of the memoir that runs into over 300 pages.

‚ÄúBarack Obama and Manmohan Singh had entered the room for an update on our group‚Äôs progress and President Obama began introducing the American team to his Indian counterpart. When he got to me‚ÄîIndra Nooyi CEO of PepsiCo‚ÄîPrime Minister Singh exclaimed ‚ÄúOh! But she is one of us!‚Äù ‚ÄúAnd the president with a big smile and without missing a beat responded ‚ÄúAh but she is one of us too!‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a moment I never forget‚Äîspontaneous kindness from the leaders of the two great countries that have given me so much‚Äù Nooyi writes in the memoir an advance copy of which was obtained by PTI.

‚ÄúI am still the girl who grew up in a close family in Madras in the South of India and I am deeply connected to the lessons and culture of my youth. I am also the woman who arrived in the US at age twenty-three to study and work and somehow rose to lead an iconic company a journey that I believe is possible only in America. I belong in both worlds‚Äù she writes narrating her immigrant story.

From a sari-clad intern at Booz Allen Hamilton rising to the post of Pepsico CEO Nooyi writes that the business world has improved immeasurably for women in the US since she started her professional career. Nooyi writes that more recently the #MeToo movement and Time‚Äôs Up campaigns have had a profound impact on exposing the degree to which women are subjected to sexual violence and harassment. The movement and campaigns have created a necessary community for survivors she observes. ‚ÄúI was never sexually assaulted. I did witness and hear about plenty of male behavior early in my days in the corporate world that offended my sense of decency and my values. I later made it a priority to shut down offensive behavior as soon as I saw it or it became known‚Äù Nooyi writes.

Nooyi says after she became PepsiCo‚Äôs president she instructed the compliance department to address harassment complaints made to their anonymous Speak Up Line immediately. ‚ÄúWe were quick to fire confirmed harassers‚Äù she writes.

In the book she rues that women hold just 26 percent of US corporate board seats. ‚ÄúIn my view companies should consider setting term limits on board members of fifteen years and a mandatory retirement age of seventy-two. Immediately they could also expand their boards by one or two members to make room for qualified people who better understand the issues facing working women and young families‚Äù she said.

Name: Pfizer
Name_1: Pfizer CEO: We can do both booster shots and primary vaccines
Text_1:
Bourla said that out of the 2 billion vaccine doses Pfizer will have produced by the end of September 500 million of the doses have already gone to middle- or lower-income countries.

‚ÄúIn the remaining of the year we will produce an additional billion doses so a total of three. And 1 billion of these doses will have gone to low- and middle-income countries. That will not change because of the approval or not of boosters‚Äù he said.

The Biden administration last week announced that a third dose of the Pfizer-BioNtech vaccine will be available to people ages 65 and older as well as adults at an elevated risk of severe Covid-19.

While announcing the rollout President Joe Biden pointed out that more than a quarter of those eligible in the U.S. have yet to get even one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine.

‚ÄúWe still have over 70 million Americans who have failed to get a single shot‚Äù Biden said on Friday. ‚ÄúThere are elected officials actively working to undermine with false information the fight against Covid-19. This is totally unacceptable.‚Äù

Biden‚Äôs announcement came after weeks of debate within his administration. An FDA panel last week voted in favor of rolling out booster shots to people over the age of 65 younger people at a high risk of severe Covid-19 and people in high-risk jobs including frontline health care workers.

But the CDC‚Äôs advisory panel which is charged with deciding which people get a shot and when did not include individuals working in high-risk settings in its ruling on booster shots. CDC Director Rochelle Walensky overruled her advisory board to also include those workers in high-risk jobs bringing the CDC‚Äôs recommendation more in line with FDA‚Äôs booster authorization.

Pfizer announced last week that a trial had showed that the Pfizer-BioNtech vaccine is safe for children ages 5-11. Bourla said that the data would be submitted to the FDA for approval soon.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a question of days not weeks‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd then it is up to FDA to be able to review the data and come to their conclusions and approve it or not. If they approve it we will be ready with our manufacturing to provide this new formulation of the vaccine because the vaccine that the kids will receive ... is a different formulation.‚Äù
Name_2: Tense decision-making as CDC joins FDA in recommending Pfizer booster shot for 65 & up people at high risk and ...
Text_2:
Following the recommendations of its vaccine advisory committee the Food and Drug Administration gave emergency use authorization to Pfizer-BioNTech‚Äôs COVID-19 vaccine booster dose for certain populations. The single shot is to be administered six months following completion of the original two-dose course.

The FDA‚Äôs Sept. 22 2021 decision to not extend boosters to the general population ‚Äì at least not yet ‚Äì was a direct rebuke to the Biden administration‚Äôs announcement in August that booster shots would be rolled out to all eligible Americans beginning in late September. Biden‚Äôs pledge had been widely criticized for getting out in front of the science and the regulatory process.

The FDA instead limited its authorization of the third Pfizer dose to people 65 and older people ages 18-64 at high risk of severe COVID-19 due to pre-existing conditions and individuals with frequent risk of exposure to the coronavirus through their work such as health care workers and teachers.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention‚Äôs Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices then issued its own booster recommendations on Sept. 23 2021. Its guidance aligned with the FDA‚Äôs authorization of boosters for use in ages 65 and up and people at high risk of severe COVID-19 but stopped short of endorsing booster shots for people with frequent occupational exposure. However in an effort to realign the two agencies‚Äô recommendations CDC director Dr. Rochelle Walensky overrode the CDC advisory committee providing the go-ahead for all groups listed under the FDA‚Äôs emergency use authorizations ‚Äì including those with increased job-site risk.

Despite the mixed messaging between the agencies the immediate effect is that millions of Americans will be in line for added protection amid concerns over waning vaccine immunity. An ongoing evaluation of whether COVID-19 boosters should be administered more broadly among vaccine-eligible people is likely to take place in the coming months as more data becomes available to inform questions of safety need and efficacy of boosters.

Fault lines between the FDA and CDC

This fraught booster approval process may strike some as strange as the FDA is solely responsible for drug approval in most contexts. However as the body responsible for managing U.S. public vaccination programs the CDC‚Äôs approval is required in order to begin the distribution and administration of vaccines.

The close intersection of the two agencies in approval and distribution of vaccines has recently become a point of contention for some high level officials with two senior FDA vaccine leaders resigning from their posts in early September 2021. One former FDA leader cited the expanding role of the CDC in vaccine evaluation as a major reason for their departure.

The tensions between these agencies was on full display when the CDC‚Äôs advisory committee excluded high occupational exposure risk as a booster-eligible group breaking from the FDA recommendation and authorization. The committee‚Äôs vote to not authorize boosters for those with frequent occupational exposures stemmed primarily from concerns that the recommendation was overly broad ‚Äì potentially leading to confusion as to who counts as a worker at ‚Äúhigh risk.‚Äù

This combined with a shared view ‚Äì including among some public health officials ‚Äì that critical pieces of data being used to advocate for the booster in the broader population were incomplete and open to interpretation resulted in a 9-6 vote from the CDC committee against the third dose for those at increased occupational risk.

Back in alignment

Ultimately Walensky‚Äôs decision to side with the FDA on extending boosters to those with frequent occupational exposure ‚Äì such as health care workers and teachers ‚Äì brings the two agencies into alignment. And while it still falls short of the Biden administration‚Äôs pledge of boosters for all vaccine-eligible people in the U.S. the decision will pave the way for millions of third Pfizer doses to be administered in the coming months.

‚ÄúAs CDC Director it is my job to recognize where our actions can have the greatest impact. At CDC we are tasked with analyzing complex often imperfect data to make concrete recommendations that optimize health. In a pandemic even with uncertainty we must take actions that we anticipate will do the greatest good‚Äù Walensky said in a statement.

More guidance on COVID-19 boosters is expected to be issued soon for people who received the Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines.

[Research into coronavirus and other news from science Subscribe to The Conversation‚Äôs new science newsletter.]
Name_3: Pfizer CEO says it's possible to distribute both boosters and primary doses
Text_3:
Pfizer CEO says it's possible to distribute both boosters and primary doses

Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said on ABC's "This Week" Sunday it's possible to provide both COVID-19 booster shots as well as doses for people who have not yet been vaccinated.

"I think it is also not the right thing to try to resolve it with an 'or' when you can resolve it with an 'and'" Bourla told "This Week" anchor George Stephanopoulos. "It's not 'Shall we give boosters or give primary doses to other people.' I think the answer should be 'Let's give both boosters and doses for other people.'"

With millions more Americans now newly eligible for a booster COVID-19 shot from Pfizer Bourla's optimism punctuates what's become a protracted hot-button issue amongst the scientific community over who needs the boost and when. The White House has stressed that the rationale for green-lighting boosters must be uncoupled from the question of global vaccinations and that one does not preclude the other.

Just after midnight Friday Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Rochelle Walensky endorsed her independent advisory panel's recommendation for seniors and other medically vulnerable Americans to get a booster shot of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine six months after their second dose partially overruling the panel by adding a recommendation for a third dose for people who are considered high risk due to where they work.

On "This Week" Sunday Bourla called that decision a "very good one."

"We are looking forward to being able to vaccinate all these vulnerable people so that we can put an end to this pandemic" Bourla told Stephanopoulos.

CEO Albert Bourla speaks at a Pfizer manufacturing site in Portage Mich. Feb. 19 2021. Evan Vucci/AP FILE
