Name_2: More than 25% of Walmart's corporate officers are people of color new report shows
Text_2:
New York CNN ‚Äî

Editor‚Äôs note: A previous version of this story and headline incorrectly stated that Walmart had not recently hired any people of color to fill executive management roles or board of director vacancies. Walmart has in fact hired several people of color for those roles in recent months. A previous version of this story also incorrectly stated that Dacona Smith was the most recent executive African American to join Walmart‚Äôs executive leadership team. In fact at least two African-American officers including John Wigneswaran and Jennifer R. Jackson were hired more recently. The story and headline have been corrected and updated with additional context.

People of color made up more than 55% of new hires at Walmart between February and July of this year and now occupy more than 25% of the retailer‚Äôs officer positions according to the company‚Äôs website and its latest diversity equity and inclusion report released Friday.

That includes at least two African-American officers who joined the company this summer the company confirmed on Saturday. Chief medical officer Dr. John Wigneswaran in July became one of the latest Black senior or executive level manager to be hired by Walmart.

In June Walmart also hired Capitol One Canada president Jennifer R. Jackson who became Walmart‚Äôs newest senior vice president of enterprise strategy mergers & acquisitions and strategic partnerships. In November Walmart hired Dr. Cheryl Pegus to serve as executive vice president of health & wellness.

Walmart says it has worked harder in recent years to increase diversity at its highest ranks. The company‚Äôs president and CEO Doug McMillon took on the issue of racial inequality during one of Walmart‚Äôs virtual employee meetings in the wake of George Floyd‚Äôs murder more than a year ago.

‚ÄúThe murder of George Floyd is tragic painful and unacceptable‚Äù McMillon told Walmart‚Äôs global employee population in June 2020. ‚ÄúWords and feelings matter but they are not enough. More action is required. We will find new ways to accelerate the desired changes inside our company and we will also find the ways that our business can influence real change in our country.‚Äù

A customer hands cash to an employee while making a purchase at a Walmart location in Burbank California on November 16 2017. Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg/Getty Images

Walmart is America‚Äôs largest private employer by far with more than 2 million employees on its global payroll 1.5 million of them in the United States alone according to the company‚Äôs latest diversity equity and inclusion report. Amazon is a distant second with 798000 employees as recently as 2019 according to Fortune.

McMillon said in June 2020 that roughly 340000 of Walmart‚Äôs employees are Black. The company‚Äôs latest report confirms that as recently as July more than 20% of its employees were Black. African Americans also make up the largest non-White employee segment of Walmart‚Äôs workforce despite comprising just 11.9% of the US population in 2020 according to the latest US Census.

Around 9% of Walmart‚Äôs corporate officers are African American the company‚Äôs latest demographic data confirms but Walmart says that‚Äôs about a 2.3% increase from this time last year.

‚ÄúWhile we are encouraged by the growth of our Black and African-American representation across our leadership team we recognize that we are on a journey and have more work to do‚Äù Walmart spokesperson Jami Lamontagne told CNN Business on Saturday.

Black members of Walmart‚Äôs executive leadership team also include executive vice president of neighborhood markets Kelvin L. Buncum senior vice president and chief global culture diversity equity & inclusion officer Ben Hasan and Dacona Smith executive vice president and chief operating officer for Walmart US.

An employee restocks frozen food products at a Walmart store in Burbank California on November 26 2019. Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg/Getty Images

Latinos make up nearly 18% of Walmart‚Äôs employee population but just 5.5% of the company‚Äôs officers according to the report. Asian people who represent more than 4% of the retailer‚Äôs employees comprise more than 10% of its managers and 9% of its officers. In August Anshu Bhardwaj was promoted to senior vice president of technology strategy & commercialization on Walmart‚Äôs global tech team.

White people make up more than 53% of Walmart‚Äôs workforce and they represent more than 63% of its managers and 74% of its officers.

The DEI report also says people of color make up more than 46% of Walmart‚Äôs workforce but the company‚Äôs website shows Black and Brown Americans comprise only about 16.7% of Walmart‚Äôs 12-member board of directors.

Retired AT&T chairman and CEO Randall Stevenson who is White joined Walmart‚Äôs board of directors in March. He‚Äôs the only director on Walmart‚Äôs board appointed since the police murder of George Floyd on May 25 2020 which motivated Walmart‚Äôs leaders to create a $100 million center on racial equity program less than two weeks later.

AT&T is the parent company of WarnerMedia which owns CNN.

NBCUniversal News Group Chairman Cesar Conde is the only Latin American on Walmart‚Äôs board of directors. He and Morgan Stanley Vice Chair of Wealth Management Carla A. Lewis who is Black are the only people of color on Walmart‚Äôs board.

People of color saw a slight uptick in promotions from hourly employees to management positions which increased more than two percentage points between January and July according to Walmart‚Äôs 2020 end-of-year DEI report.

Last October the Executive Leadership Council a nonprofit that works to increase the number of black executives in Corporate America gave Walmart its 2020 Corporate Award honoring ‚Äúcompanies that value and reward contributions talents and leadership of Black employees.‚Äù

In its most recent DEI report Walmart pointed out marginal gains women have made at the officer level as well as the May launch of its Accessibility Center of Excellence which is designed to advance equity and inclusion for people with disabilities.

Walmart also was one of 24 companies that commissioned global consulting firm McKinsey & Co. to research challenges Black Americans face in the private sector.

‚ÄúIt further reinforces the importance of addressing these complex systemic issues through our internal people processes‚Äù Walmart executive vice president and chief people officer Donna Morris said in the report.

The study determined ‚Äúeducational attainment has an outsized impact‚Äù on the employment gap facing African Americans. Walmart announced that it would cover 100% of its workers‚Äô college tuition about six months after the McKinsey study was published.

‚ÄúAlthough we have made progress we still have more work to do‚Äù the company told CNN Business Friday via email.
Name_3: Police: Man Stabbed In Head With Machete After Argument At Walmart In Kearny N.J.
Text_3:
KEARNY N.J. (CBSNewYork) -- There was chaos inside a Walmart in Kearny New Jersey when a man was stabbed with a machete during an argument Friday police said.

Police got to the store on Harrison Avenue around 10:30 a.m. after someone called 911 to report an assault CBS2's Jenna DeAngelis reported.

Police said they found a 43-year-old man inside the store with a deep cut and blood streaming down the back of his head.

As CBS2's Jessica Layton reports police say the two strangers had an argument while standing in line and punches were thrown before the machete was swung.

"It was an altercation between two people and then they one guy pulled out it was like a sword and he cut it. People see him laying on the ground and one guy was bleeding from the head. It was terrible" witness Thomas Underwood said. "It was just a stampede of people who were running. One girl got trampled. She ended up going to the hospital. She got hurt she hurt her leg."

The suspect left the store before officers arrived police said.

The victim was taken to University Hospital in Newark. He was released after having the wound stapled closed.

Watch Jenna DeAngelis' report --

Investigators said they do not believe the suspect and the victim knew each other.

Shoppers were let back inside the store around 2:30 p.m.

"It was just total chaos. I was scared for my life" said a shopper.

She described the terrifying moments when she was trampled and hurt while running out of the Walmart.

"I was knocked to the floor instantaneously. At this moment I don't know what's going on. I just saw dozens of people running towards the exit. Someone screamed he had a gun" she told DeAngelis.

"I just started seeing people screaming and running and I'm like 'What's going on?'" said Ray Martin who saw the suspect swinging the weapon.

Martin believes the victim jumped in to stop the suspect but police dispute his account. They say the men were throwing punches before the machete came out.

"It was crazy. Everybody just grabbed their kids and everybody ran" a Walmart employee said.

Chopper 2 video showed the line of fire and police vehicles outside the store.

Shoppers were left concerned.

"How did he even bring the machete in? Something so large so visible. To even bring that in is beyond me" another shopper said. "It's a scary world out there and you just have to watch what we do and be aware of our surroundings."

Police said the suspect brought the machete into the store. It appeared to be hidden under his clothes.

"This is the first time we ever seen something crazy like this and I don't know if I'm coming back to this Walmart" another woman said.

Late Friday night police said a suspect was arrested in Newark. Further details including the suspect's identity have not yet been released.

Kearny detectives just arrested the suspect from today's Walmart machete assault. He was taken into custody moments ago in Newark. More information to follow when available. ‚Äî Kearny Police (@KearnyPolice) September 25 2021

"We are shocked by Friday's incident and are hopeful the injured customer recovers quickly. We are grateful to law enforcement for their quick response and are helping them in any way we can" a Walmart spokesperson said.

CBS2's Jessica Layton contributed to this report. Editor's note: This story was first published Sept. 24.

Name: Walt Disney
Name_1: Watch 'The Most Magical Story on Earth: 50 Years of Walt Disney World' Friday October 1 on ABC
Text_1:
In celebration of the 50th Anniversary of Walt Disney World Resort ABC will present a spectacular television event "The Most Magical Story on Earth: 50 Years of Walt Disney World" taking viewers on a historical journey spanning half a century and beyond at Walt Disney World in Florida. Hosted by Disney Legend and moderator of ABC's "The View" Whoopi Goldberg the two-hour program will feature spectacular visuals and musical performances from Christina Aguilera and Disney's "The Little Mermaid" Halle Bailey in front of the legendary Cinderella Castle at Magic Kingdom Park accompanied by the renowned Orlando Philharmonic Orchestra; as well as interviews with iconic actors actresses and athletes Walt Disney World cast members Disney Imagineers and executives past and present who have all played their unique part in sprinkling pixie dust over "The Most Magical Place on Earth." "The Most Magical Story on Earth: 50 Years of Walt Disney World" airs FRIDAY OCT. 1 (8:00-10:01 p.m. EDT) on ABC. It can also be viewed the next day on demand and on Hulu and later in the month on Disney+.

This EARidescent special event will take viewers through Walt Disney World's humble beginnings in the swamplands of Florida and its evolution into a cultural phenomenon. Through an expansive look into the past present and future of the vacation destination fans will get a never-before-seen-on-TV glimpse into the journey to bring Walt's vision to life and a look at grand plans for the future. The special will also document some of Walt Disney World's most memorable pop-culture moments from the many sitcoms that filmed episodes in the theme parks to the conception of the ubiquitous "I'm going to Disney World!" campaign. Plus viewers will get a heartwarming look at how Disney and Make-A-Wish foundation have worked together for over 40 years to make kids' Disney dreams come true.

Celebrities including Anthony Anderson John Stamos Marsai Martin Melissa Joan Hart Candace Cameron Bure and Gary Sinise; NFL athletes Tom Brady Phil Simms and Doug Williams; and creative forces Kevin Feige Pete Docter and James Cameron; Walt Disney World Imagineers including Bob Weis Mark Kohl and Ann Morrow Johnson; and Disney executives past and present including Bob Chapek Bob Iger and Michael Eisner will all share their favorite memories of Walt Disney World the unparalleled family destination. "The Most Magical Story on Earth: 50 Years of Walt Disney World" is produced by ABC News in association with ABC Entertainment and Disney Parks Global Content. David Sloan and Sally Conner are senior executive producers and Matt Lombardi is executive producer. Follow ABC Publicity on Twitter and Instagram for up-to-date news on (#DisneyWorld50).

The early days: Walt Disney World history in photos

Florida Times-Union

While it wouldn't be until Oct. 1 1971 that Walt Disney World opened its gates to the public preparations for the park started a few years earlier.

The creator of Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck earlier talked during a luncheon attended by a packed audience of business leaders and legislators. At right is brother of the movie magnate Roy. During luncheon and a later press conference Disney gave a rough outline of what he plans to do with the 30000 acres plus he has acquired in Orange and Osceola counties. AP Photo/Fred Noel

Name_3: Why is Walt Disney World SO Big?
Text_3:
Walt Disney World is huge. Not only in the metaphorical ‚Äúdominate the American imagination sense‚Äô but in the literal sense. The Walt Disney Company owns more land in Central Florida than they‚Äôll likely ever be able to develop.

Don‚Äôt believe us? Well in the five decades since WDW opened to the public the company has built four theme parks three (one defunct) water parks the entire Disney Springs complex nearly 30 resort hotels and a bevy of backstage infrastructure over half of the land they own is still undeveloped land and at their disposal.

So why did Disney buy so much extra land in Florida? To paraphrase it all started with a man‚Ä¶ the man in fact: Walt Disney himself.

To understand why Walt Disney insisted on so much land for the Florida Project that would eventually morph into Walt Disney World one must understand Disneyland. Walt poured his heart soul and pocketbook into building The Happiest Place on Earth buying as much land in Anaheim as he could afford for the theme park. Famously Walt couldn‚Äôt even afford to build an on-site hotel at the time instead entrusting businessman Jack Wrather with the rights to build the Disneyland Hotel.

Suffice to say Walt‚Äôs money problems quickly evaporated when Disneyland opened to rave reviews and astonishing success in 1955. The Disneyland hotel which opened a few months after the park was also a smash hit and the Wrather Corporation had a successful partnership with Disney until the 1980s when ‚Äúthe Mouse‚Äù acquired the company to gain control of the Hotel property.

However while Walt and Jack Wrather enjoyed a warm partnership the same couldn‚Äôt be said for the majority of Disney‚Äôs neighbors. After the park‚Äôs successful opening land around Disneyland skyrocketed in value and was quickly gobbled up by entrepreneurs eager to ride Walt‚Äôs coattails. All manner of hotels motels and tourist traps sprouted up literally steps from the park many of which didn‚Äôt live up to Disney‚Äôs standards. Furthermore much to Walt‚Äôs chagrin these establishments encroached on the park audibly and even visually at times.

As Disney began planning to open a second theme park in the early 1960s he searched everywhere from St. Louis to New York to find the perfect site. Given what happened in Anaheim it‚Äôs perhaps unsurprising that buying and controlling a large amount of land was at the top of Disney‚Äôs list when searching for sites and in fact was a deciding factor in ruling out several areas. Of course in addition to the desire to control the land around his park Walt also had an ulterior motive for looking for such a large piece of land: his dream of the original version of EPCOT AKA the Experimental Prototype Community of Tomorrow.

This search eventually led to approximately 25000 acres of land in Central Florida near Orlando. According to Disney legend Walt saw the eventual WDW site from above during a scouting flight and immediately knew that that‚Äôs where what-was-then-called simply Disney World (and EPCOT) needed to be built.

Not wanting to call attention to themselves and in-turn lead to an Anaheim-esque spike in land value Disney went about acquiring the land somewhat surreptitiously. The company set up numerous dummy corporations (the pun-names of which are immortalized on several Main Street U.S.A. windows at the Magic Kingdom) to acquire different pieces of land.

Despite Disney‚Äôs best efforts rumors quickly began to spread that all of the land was being purchased by one entity with speculation ranging from Disney to NASA to the Ford Motor Company. Eventually Disney was exposed as being behind the land purchases by the Orlando Sentinel in the fall of 1965 forcing Disney to reveal their initial plans for Disney World earlier than Walt had planned.

Roughly a year after the news of Disney World was confirmed Walt spoke about the land purchase in Florida in relation to some of the issues the company had faced with Disneyland:

‚ÄúThe one thing I learned from Disneyland was to control the environment. Without that we get blamed for the things that someone else does. When they come here they‚Äôre coming because of an integrity that we‚Äôve established over the years and they drive for hundreds of miles and the little hotels on the fringe would jump their rates three times. I‚Äôve seen it happen and I just can‚Äôt take it because I mean it reflects on us. I just feel a responsibility to the public when I go into this thing that we must control that and when they come into this so-called world that we will take the blame for what goes on.‚Äù

Furthermore Walt uttered a famous phrase which is still used by Disney to describe WDW to this very day. ‚ÄúHere in Florida we have something special we never enjoyed at Disneyland‚Ä¶the blessing of size. There‚Äôs enough land here to hold all the ideas and plans we can possibly imagine.‚Äù (1966 Forum Special)

While Walt Disney would pass only months later and many things about Disney World would change (including the name being changed to ‚ÄúWalt Disney World‚Äù in tribute as well as the abandonment of EPCOT‚Äôs original incarnation) the concept of the ‚ÄúBlessing of Size‚Äù is still a fundamental part of Walt Disney World.

Do you think Walt Disney was right to push to acquire so much land in Central Florida or did he go overboard? Let us know in the comments below.

Comments (5)
Name_4: UPDATED: First Look at Walt Disney World's 50th Anniversary Merchandise!
Text_4:
It is Walt Disney World‚Äôs 50th Anniversary Celebration and they are getting the party started with some sparkly new merchandise! The festivities officially begin October 1st but many of the items were released early. We‚Äôve been updating this article with new items as they are released.

Walt Disney World‚Äôs 50th Anniversary merchandise was created with five festive collections in mind. The Celebration Collection includes merchandise featuring Mickey and the gang dressed up in fancy get-ups for the special occasion along with other colorful items. The Disney Castle Collection utilizes Magic Kingdom‚Äôs Cinderella Castle as its central motif. The Vault Collection reimagines merchandise that was originally released around Walt Disney World‚Äôs opening day. As the name suggests the merchandise in the EARidescent Collection shimmers and shines. And finally the Luxe Logo Collection offers the most upscale merchandise created for the 50th anniversary.

This article focuses on the Celebration and Castle Collections but we‚Äôll link you to the other lines at the bottom of this article. And it is important to remember that Walt Disney World still has a purchase limit in place of a maximum of two of each item per guest.

Can‚Äôt Visit Walt Disney World for the 50th Anniversary?

If you are unable to make it over to Walt Disney World but still want the opportunity to purchase some lovely merchandise all hope is not lost. Some items of these items will be available for purchase on shopDisney. On October 1 merchandise from the Celebration and Vault Collections will be listed. Some of the collections will arrive at a later currently unannounced date.

Celebration Collection

Clothing

This sweatshirt combines a nice big screen-printed graphic of a Tuxedo‚Äôd Mickey Mouse with a smaller metallic 50th logo on the chest. The combination of the two styles works well together.

This camp shirt has an ‚Äò‚Äùit‚Äôs a small world‚Äù vibe to it don‚Äôt you think?

Minnie and Cinderella Castle are printed on the chest of this women‚Äôs V-neck shirt.

Man Disney sure loves their crop tops. Here we see a cropped hoodie and matching lounge pants sold separately.

As we can see from the graphics on this sweatshirt T-shirt and kid‚Äôs raglan shirt Mickey is getting his tux all neat and pretty for the big party.

A similar graphic of Mickey with Donald Goofy and Pluto is seen on this sweatshirt and this tie-dyed shirt.

This kid‚Äôs zippered jacket is eye-catching.

If your littlest one loves Minnie you might want to give this onesie a look.

This new Minnie Mouse costume dress resembles the outfit Minnie is wearing for the 50th celebration.

This ringer T-shirt may not have Mickey and Co. on it but it highlights some of Walt Disney World‚Äôs beloved attractions.

Accessories

If you are going to Walt Disney World the odds are good that a Magicband is in your future (though they are no longer required). And if you are heading there for the 50th anniversary you can snag one of these beauties.

I think we can all agree that the Florida sun is brutal but there are two new themed hats to help provide some relief from the harsh rays.

Nothing says ‚ÄúDisney Parks merchandise‚Äù quite like a Mickey Ear Hat and this one is extra-special. It has iridescent stuffed ears with a matching Mickey patch on the front.

Ear Headband party! We‚Äôve got one with a foam bow that is remarkably similar to something released for Disneyland‚Äôs fiftieth celebration (with a different color scheme) a design from Loungefly covered with Mickey and his pals and one that lights up. The last one is especially notable because it is charged via USB cable which is included with the Ear Headband. I would love to see this feature incorporated into more light-up items in the future.

This light-up bow would be perfect paired with the Minnie Mouse costume dress for kids we saw earlier.

This Loungefly Mini Backpack not only matches one of the Ear Headbands seen earlier but it even has a special pocket to hold them! You can unzip the designated pocket to reveal straps with metal snaps used to secure the Ear Headband.

It is not a celebration until commemorative Crocs are released for it. These shoes are decorated with art of Mickey and friends and come with a special Walt Disney World 50th charm attached to them.

Baublebar contributed this festive (and likely very heavy) pair of earrings featuring Mickey and Minnie Mouse with fireworks.

If you don‚Äôt fancy wearing your Ear Headband on your head but still want to show your love for the accessory Alex and Ani have this beaded bracelet with an Ear Headband charm.

And while this beaded bracelet may not have a fancy pedigree it is still a lovely accessory.

Toys

You can purchase plush toy versions of Mickey Minnie Pluto and Chip n‚Äô Dale (the pair are a set) in the same outfits seen on other 50th Anniversary merchandise. My favorites are Pluto and Chip n‚Äô Dale. What about you?

There is also a mini plush keychain of Mickey in a similar outfit.

If you are a fan of those posable stuffed nuiMOs Walt Disney World guests will find a themed Spirit Jersey sized just for the toys. The back says ‚ÄúWalt Disney World‚Äù and the front chest has a little ‚Äú50‚Äù on it.

While not as huggable as a stuffed friend this 50th Anniversary Cinderella Castle playset is incredibly impressive. It includes figures of Mickey Minnie Donald Daisy and Goofy along with an interactive Cinderella Castle with Monorail Dumbo the Flying Elephant and Mad Tea Party elements. One of my favorite details is that the playset‚Äôs castle is decorated with the same sign and anniversary ribbons as the real one.

Decor and Home Goods

This item is going to sell like hotcakes I guarantee it. It is a foaming hand soap dispenser that magically creates a hidden mickey out of soap when pushed down.

You‚Äôll find magnets adorned with Mickey and company as well including a magnetic clip!

For all your beverage consumption needs there is a character-filled mug and an attraction-covered water bottle.

On one side of this spinning ornament you‚Äôll find Mickey‚Äôs smiling face. On the other are tons of attractions found at Walt Disney World.

Other

I love that Disney is incorporating reusable utensils into more of their merchandise collections. This set has a reusable plastic fork knife and spoon all packaged in this fun carrying case. I do wish the utensils were made of bamboo as opposed to plastic but this still a step in the right direction.

Make a far-off friend insanely jealous and send them one of these lenticular postcards. Use the new pen seen below as well for double the fun.

Sweet treats like a tin of mints packaged flavored popcorn a fancy chocolate truffle box a giant lollipop and a milk chocolate bar with popping candy on the inside are all themed to the occasion. There is even a special coffee blend by Joffrey‚Äôs crafted especially for the celebration.

Are there pins? Yes there are pins! And starter sets lanyards and lanyard medallions too!

I must confess I did not know that a ‚Äúsouvenir booster pack‚Äù was a thing but I do now. It contains magnets buttons a keychain and such all in one convenient package.

Disney Castle Collection

Apparel

Do you wear women‚Äôs shirts and like castles? Here are two shirts just for you.

In terms of layering options from the Castle Collection include a hoodie and track jacket.

This special polo shirt was created by Nike.

This camp shirt is a lot less busy than the multicolored one from the Celebration Collection.

The Partners Statue gets some love on the chest of this T-shirt.

Accessories

I absolutely adore this Loungefly Mini Backpack. It has gorgeous art of Cinderella Castle on the front complemented by lovely golden accents on the from and embroidery on the side. It has one compartment compared to the typical two-pocket model seen more frequently in Disney Parks. I would buy this one in a heartbeat.

This tote bag has a good capacity and padded handles to boot.

Nike gets in on the Partners Statue appreciation with this hat.

Thanks to Baublebar this collection also has earrings a charm bracelet and a necklace.

Alex and Ani add an simpler layer of golden glamor to Cinderella Castle with this bangle and matching necklace sold separately.

Toys

Over the past few years I have come to appreciate puzzles as family activities. However I do think that with all that similar-looking sky this one might be tricky.

Decor and Home Goods

Cinderella Castle looks just like an old-time photograph on this tasseled dish towel set.

The delicate castle art looks great on ceramic as we can see from this mug and jewelry box.

Whether as a magnet or on top of an ornament the figures of Cinderella Castle are almost as striking as the real thing.

For optimal results I suggest you stick a photo of your loved ones in front of Cinderella Castle inside this castle-themed magnet frame.

Thanks to this throw blanket you can wrap yourself in a large woven image of the Partners statue.

Here are the rest of the lines (or when we expect them to be released):

Anniversary Collection

On the actual anniversary October 1st guests were able to buy these extremely limited items:

Vault Collection

This is an amazing collection folks. Probably our favorite. Here are all the nostalgic details:

EARidescent Collection

Arriving late October 2021 ‚Äì Check back with us for more on this collection soon!

Luxe Logo Collection

Arriving November 2021!

In addition to the special merchandise collections Disney has also updated the look of their reusable shopping bags which are sold at many stores at the Resort. All three bag sizes (small medium and large) now have 50th anniversary art on them.

Disney Theme Park Ticket & Travel Deals

It‚Äôs time to give the family something to look forward to. Our travel partners at Get Away Today are here to help you plan a future theme park vacation. There are all sorts of new theme park tickets and travel deals including 25% off select rooms at Walt Disney World & Disneyland ticket deals to Disney and Universal theme parks and special vacation package deals: More details and to get a quote (HERE)

Let‚Äôs Hear from You

What do you think of the WDW 50th Anniversary merchandise so far? And which line do you like best?

We have all the new rides shows restaurants lodging merchandise and more from Walt Disney World‚Äôs 50th Anniversary for you at the link below:

10/02.21 Update: Links to other merchandise collections added

9/23/21 Update: Added information about shopDisney selling merchandise for the 50th Anniversary. Added more items to the Celebration and Castle Collections.
